definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: He lives in Hong Kong and commutes.
sentences.chinese: 他住在香港而通勤往来。

sentences.english: It's easy to write this off, but commutes are a terrible drain on happiness.
sentences.chinese: 写这很容易，但通勤严重影响幸福感。

sentences.english: Enter the permit number for the Cross Border Commuter Permit.
sentences.chinese: 输入“跨境通勤者许可证”的许可证号码。

sentences.english: People with long commutes tend to die younger.
sentences.chinese: 那些通勤时间较长的人也倾向于“英年早逝”。

sentences.english: Barry commutes to and from school by train.
sentences.chinese: 贝瑞以火车通勤上下学。

sentences.english: Some workers in Australia commute from the Philippines and New Zealand.
sentences.chinese: 一些矿工在澳大利亚和菲律宾与新西兰之间通勤。

sentences.english: With gas prices high, many suburbanites yearn for a shorter commute.
sentences.chinese: 油价上涨，许多市郊居民开始怀念短途通勤。

sentences.english: Most of them live in the city. We provide free commuter buses for the workers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分工人住在市里，我们有免费的通勤车接送他们。

sentences.english: For more than two weeks this month, I commuted between two countries each day.
sentences.chinese: 本月，我在两座城市间往返通勤了两个多星期。

sentences.english: In addition, with the current air traffic control system commuting would not be possible.
sentences.chinese: 此外，目前的空中交通管制系统通勤将是不可能的。

sentences.english: She catches up on sleep when commuting.
Most of them come into Grand Central Station.
sentences.chinese: 多数通勤者会去中央车站。

sentences.english: It has been suggested that commuters should share their cars and give each other lifts.
sentences.chinese: 有人建议通勤者合用车辆，并让彼此搭顺路车。

sentences.english: In addition, a transit map was on display to aid commuters.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还在交通地图上显示急救通勤情况。

sentences.english: I acutely and resolutely refuted the brutal persecution of mute com muter .
sentences.chinese: 我尖锐和坚决地反驳了对无声的通勤者的残忍的迫害。

sentences.english: The recent hike in bus fares came as a shock to commuters.
sentences.chinese: 最近公车车费飙涨，令通勤族大感震惊。

definition: to go out somewhere (relatively short trip)/to set off on a journey (longer trip)
public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
